body.section: The Menu Bar, as shown in , provides tools to manage certain application and configuration functions, as described below, that are typically handled by a system administrator. The functions available via the menu bar may vary from installation to installation, and may include the ability to invoke local business processes.

File Menu File Menu
File Menu
Import Java Changeset - Downloads changes from subversion. Import Java Changeset
Change Password - Allows you to change your logon password. Change Password
Save Profile - Save the current IHTSDO IDE status (including taxonomy display, displayed icons and windows) in a profile, which is selected at startup. IHTSDO IDE provides another opportunity to save this profile when you quit the application.Save Profile
Save Profile As... - Allows you to save an alternate profile.
Generate Java Binding from Refset... - Displays the current version of the application database. database configuration
Show Configuration Info - Displays the current version of the application database. database configuration
Work Online - Allows sharing of change sets via a communal Subversion managed repository. onlinesynchronisationvia subversion
Work Offline - Disables sharing of change sets via a communal Subversion managed repository. offlinesynchronisationdisable
Quit - Exits IHTSDO IDE.

Edit Menu
Cut, Copy, Paste - Provides access to standard editing functions - Cut, Copy and Paste. You can also access these functions via keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl-X, Ctrl-C, Ctrl-V).
Export Current Refset Spec - Takes the refset currently in the Refset pane of the Component Panel and exports the corresponding specification refset to a nominated file.
body.p: Import refset spec from file - Reads a refset specification file, selected by the file chooser and imports into a named refset specification.
Modify overall refset status... - Runs a built in Business Process to change the status of a refset.
Generate difference report - Runs a Business process to identify differences that have occurred subsequent to a commit, or between different terminology versions. See
Run Classifier - Runs a Business Process that invokes the built in IHTSDO Classifier. The classifier is an important tool for validating additions and changes to SNOMED terminologies. See
body.section: New - Provides options to create new instances of an Adminstrator Window, Editor Window or Log Viewer.
Activity Viewer, Editor Window, Workflow Bundle - Provides options to access different instances of IHTSDO Workbench.

section.title: Help Menu
section.p: helponlinedocumentation Open PDF Guidebook... - Opens the documentation for the IHTSDO Workbench in the default PDF viewer.
Open HTML Guidebook... - Opens the documentation for the IHTSDO Workbench in the default HTML browser.
